summary: The 'Tim Hart Wildland Firefighter Classification and Pay Parity Act' aims to improve the pay, benefits, and working conditions of federal wildland firefighters. Key provisions include special base rates of pay, incident response premium pay, rest and recuperation leave, health provisions (including a cancer and cardiovascular disease database and mental health programs), retirement benefits, and pay parity with structural firefighters. The bill also establishes a Wildland Fire Management Casualty Assistance Program and addresses service credit for retirement.
